alert.note: Alert for Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. Helena, north central Livingston and northwestern Tangipahoa Parishes through 445 PM CDT... At 415 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Montpelier, or 9 miles south of Greensburg, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensburg, Amite, Amite City, Kentwood, Roseland, Montpelier, Darlington, Easleyville and Tangipahoa. This includes Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 44 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena
